channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israeli settlers in Gaza? Netanyahu’s allies lay out a strategy
item.description: Settling Gaza is not Israel’s official policy. But prominent politicians took part in a pro-settlement rally Monday, and some see possibility in what recently appeared to be a far-fetched proposition.
item.content:encoded:
Settling Gaza is not Israel’s official policy. But prominent politicians took part in a pro-settlement rally Monday, and some see possibility in what recently appeared to be a far-fetched proposition.

(Image credit: Ilia Yefimovich)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Harris to call attention to abortion rights. And, Biden to issue historic apology.
item.description: In Texas, Vice President Harris will call attention to abortion rights. Beyoncé will also make a guest appearance to perform. And, Biden to issue historic apology to Native Americans while in Arizona.
item.content:encoded:
In Texas, Vice President Harris will call attention to abortion rights. Beyoncé will also make a guest appearance to perform. And, Biden to issue historic apology to Native Americans while in Arizona.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Lead in cinnamon: Where do things stand, 1 year after a scary recall?
item.description: Last Halloween, the FDA said that some cinnamon, a spice loved by many kids and adults, was contaminated with lead, a metal that can cause irreversible damage in babies and young children.
item.content:encoded:
Last Halloween, the FDA said that some cinnamon, a spice loved by many kids and adults, was contaminated with lead, a metal that can cause irreversible damage in babies and young children.

(Image credit: FDA)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Minnesota is a refuge for trans health care. Here's how doctors are meeting the need
item.description: As more states ban gender care for youth, doctors and clinics in Minnesota are building up capacity to help the influx of trans patients who are traveling or moving to the state for care.
item.content:encoded:
As more states ban gender care for youth, doctors and clinics in Minnesota are building up capacity to help the influx of trans patients who are traveling or moving to the state for care. 

(Image credit: Selena Simmons-Duffin)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: For his first Halloween in the U.S., British man takes a stab at scare acting
item.description: In this week's StoryCorps, a man from Briton remembers his first Halloween in America.
item.content:encoded: In this week's StoryCorps, a man from Briton remembers his first Halloween in America.
item.dc:creator: Esther Honig

item.title: DOJ lawyers slam 'glaring gap' in failure to investigate potential Israeli crimes
item.description: The four-page letter addressed to Attorney General Merrick Garland calls on the department to investigate potential crimes committed by Israeli soldiers and civilians and is a rare instance of public disagreement inside the department.
item.content:encoded:
The four-page letter addressed to Attorney General Merrick Garland calls on the department to investigate potential crimes committed by Israeli soldiers and civilians and is a rare instance of public disagreement inside the department.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Harris will enlist Beyoncé as Trump sits with Joe Rogan for a Texas-sized final push
item.description: Texas isn't a swing state, but both campaigns will visit on Friday. Beyoncé will perform at a Harris rally focused on abortion rights, while popular podcaster Joe Rogan interviews Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Texas isn't a swing state, but both campaigns will visit on Friday. Beyoncé will perform at a Harris rally focused on abortion rights, while popular podcaster Joe Rogan interviews Trump.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Ballot drop boxes are often the subject of false claims. Here's what to know
item.description: Election officials say ballot drop boxes are a secure and accessible way for voters to return mail ballots, but they've also been the subject of numerous attacks from Donald Trump and his allies.
item.content:encoded:
Election officials say ballot drop boxes are a secure and accessible way for voters to return mail ballots, but they've also been the subject of numerous attacks from Donald Trump and his allies.

(Image credit: Olivier Touron)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: This week's quiz includes the word 'beclown' (if that's even a real word)
item.description: How does one write a not-offensively blithe question about accusations of fascism? This week's quiz walks that ethical tightrope.
item.content:encoded: How does one write a not-offensively blithe question about accusations of fascism? This week's quiz walks that ethical tightrope.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: ‘Silent Hill 2’ is a hit. That’s good news for Konami as it returns to the classics
item.description: The success of Silent Hill 2, and the announcement of several other projects, begs the question: How serious is Konami about revitalizing its most beloved franchises?
item.content:encoded:
The success of Silent Hill 2, and the announcement of several other projects, begs the question: How serious is Konami about revitalizing its most beloved franchises?

(Image credit: David McNew)
item.dc:creator: Vincent Acovino
